statement.tex: \text{Find the integral of the function}\\ \dfrac{\cos 2 x- \cos 2 \alpha}{\cos x - \cos \alpha}

step.context: \text{Are the following calculations and analysis correct?}
step.tex:
\begin{align}
\dfrac{\cos 2 x- \cos 2 \alpha}{\cos x - \cos \alpha} &= \dfrac{(2 \cos^2 x - 1) - (2 \cos^2 \alpha - 1) }{ \cos x - \cos \alpha}\\ &= \dfrac{2( \cos^2 x - \cos^2 \alpha)}{ (\cos x - \cos \alpha)}\\ \end{align}\\ \quad \quad \qquad = \dfrac{2( \cos^2 x - \cos^2 \alpha)}{ (\cos x - \cos \alpha)} \times \left( \dfrac{\cos x + \cos \alpha}{\cos x + \cos \alpha} \right) \\ \quad \quad \qquad = \dfrac{2( \cos^2 x - \cos^2 \alpha)(\cos x + \cos \alpha)}{ (\cos^2 x - \cos^2 \alpha)} \\ \quad \quad \qquad = 2 ( \cos x + \cos \alpha)
